After finding love in the United States, Colin Murugiah moved from his Colchester, England home near London and married. Now, for the past two and a half years, Murugiah has been living in Northwest Arkansas were, for more than a year, he has been teaching other writers the craft of creative writing, specializing in science fiction and fantasy.

Murugiah says that more businesses could benefit from having creative writers working for them. Though Murugiah’s home office is located in Arkansas, he can serve the needs of English specking students anywhere in the world.

Murugiah has started a business for the purpose of teaching creative writing called Write Your World. And his classes help students not only to create their own fictional world but to write their first book. Murugiah also helps his students build plot and create characters for their stories.

Murugiah’s programes include:

Homeschoolers

Homeschoolers: Write a Book
Teaching homeschoolers to write a book*, start to finish. Learn about characters, plot, arcing storylines, subplots, and world-building. Exercises & homework each session. Complete book by the end.
*Fantasy or science fiction genre

Homeschoolers: Building Your Portfolio
A set of exercises & homework to help craft your child’s creative writing portfolio with shorts, 1-2k in length to 5k in length.

Adult programs

Course 1: Write a Novel
A branching plot-line is provided, where the writer alters key elements. Teaching on characters, story, and setting. Each session has exercises and homework. By the end, have your novel’s first draft completed. Fantasy or science fiction genre.

Course 2: Developing Your Writing
With additional exercises and tailored lessons, helping you develop existing projects.

Course 3: Building Your Portfolio
Exercises & homework, for pieces 5-10k in length. Craft a portfolio of shorts.

Workshops:

Build a novel from scratch
Utilizing Creative Writing for Business
Details: Teaching & working with businesses to use their origin story and other unique features creatively in their copy.

We also have one-on-ones and editorial services.

C. R. Murugiah
Author, Creative Writing Coach, Consultant & Development Editor

You can visit Murugiah’s website at https://artandscienceofworldbuilding.com/
